Stem: Light green, slender, pithy, exudes a milky sap when cut.
Leaves: Lance shaped with irregular lobes or toothed edges. Generally in flat rosette. Usually very hairy.
Flowers: Solitary dandelion like, on long branched stems, round with many yellow straplike petals.
FruitSeeds: Orange-brown 4-7 mm long 1 seeded fruit with a long slender beak and in globular grouping with parachuiting hairs.
Habitat: Pastures, gardens, lawns, paddocks, roadsides, waste areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: More hairy leaves than Hypochaeris glabra, branched flower stalk compared to single in dandelion.
